verses.verse: And (1 Cor. 10:31) whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him.
The Christian Home (1 Pet. 3:1) Wives, submit to your own husbands, ((Col. 3:18—4:1; Eph. 5:22—6:9)) as is fitting in the Lord.
((Eph. 5:25; 1 Pet. 3:7)) Husbands, love your wives and do not be (Eph. 4:31) bitter toward them.
(Eph. 6:1) Children, obey your parents (Eph. 5:24) in all things, for this is well pleasing to the Lord.
(Eph. 6:4) Fathers, do not provoke your children, lest they become discouraged.
(Eph. 6:5; (1 Tim. 6:1); Titus 2:9; 1 Pet. 2:18) Bondservants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh, not with eyeservice, as men-pleasers, but in sincerity of heart, fearing God.
((Eccl. 9:10)) And whatever you do, do it heartily, as to the Lord and not to men,
(Eph. 6:8) knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; (1 Cor. 7:22) for you serve the Lord Christ.
But he who does wrong will be repaid for what he has done, and (Rom. 2:11) there is no partiality.
Masters, (Eph. 6:9) give your bondservants what is just and fair, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
Christian Graces (Luke 18:1) Continue earnestly in prayer, being vigilant in it (Col. 2:7) with thanksgiving;
(Eph. 6:19) meanwhile praying also for us, that God would (1 Cor. 16:9) open to us a door for the word, to speak (Eph. 3:3, 4; 6:19) the mystery of Christ, (Eph. 6:20) for which I am also in chains,
that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
(Eph. 5:15) Walk in ((Matt. 10:16)) wisdom toward those who are outside, (Eph. 5:16) redeeming the time.
Let your speech always be (Eccl. 10:12) with grace, (Mark 9:50) seasoned with salt, (1 Pet. 3:15) that you may know how you ought to answer each one.
Final Greetings (Acts 20:4; Eph. 6:21; 2 Tim. 4:12; Titus 3:12) Tychicus, a beloved brother, faithful minister, and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.
(Eph. 6:22) I am sending him to you for this very purpose, that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts,
with (Philem. 10) Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all things which are happening here.
